author: chfast
content: Oh good job. I can hit it with B iterations.

author: ben_a_adams
content: Is Nethermind pariticipating in fuzzing? And if not can someone help walk me through what needs to be done here?

author: draganrakita
content: I dont think it is added. Fuzzer calls evm's with cli in continuous loop that prints results. https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/issues/146#issuecomment-2266193196

author: _shemnon
content: Besu's fuzzer can run nethermind, `./gradlew fuzzNethermind` will fuzz besu and nethermind, if `netheofparse` is in the path. - https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/testfuzz/README.md

author: _shemnon
content: However The fuzzing corpus is based off of the reference tests.  So any ref tests failures will light the fuzzer up.

author: _shemnon
content: Those directions use the old tests, I need to add extracting the EEST fixtures for the seed.  If you unzip and put the eof_test contents from 1.0.9 in the ethereum tests dir it will pick it up.

author: marioevz
content:
Hey <@403707149043105803> I just went over #789 and I created a PR to your branch with some extra variants to the tests you proposed: https://github.com/shemnon/execution-spec-tests/pull/6

But I'm interested on `test_jumpf_diff_max_stack_height`, it seems to me that it should fail differently, so wanted to see if you and <@275684146658148352>  or <@425274498732916736>  could take a look, there might be something there.

author: _shemnon
content:
I was debating splitting it into two different tests even though the testing flow is basically the same.

The first three tests are validating this line from EIP-6206 for JUMPF
> stack_height_min and stack_height_max MUST be equal to type[current_section_index].outputs + type[target_section_index].inputs - type[target_section_index].outputs. This means that target section can output less stack elements than the original code section called by the top element on the return stack, if the current code section leaves the delta type[current_section_index].outputs - type[target_section_index].outputs element(s) on the stack.

The last three are testing this line above it for JUMPF
> either type[current_section_index].outputs MUST be greater or equal type[target_section_index].outputs,
(the or about non-returning seems to be covered already)

author: _shemnon
content: test case 4 covers a Geth fuzzing find.  So of all the tests in that block it's the only "must keep". Geth differed on it and there were no other tests inducing that behavior.

author: marioevz
content: Created another PR, basically the same test again but now min_stack_height is different to the other two tests
